answers.answer: Hello,your blood sugars are still very high, and this may be detrimental to your baby (in early pregnancy high sugars can affect heart and spinal cord development).  Target fasting blood sugar is typically < 95.  Target post eating is maximum 140, and ideally < 120.You need to work very closely with your doctor to adjust your insulin doses to bring your sugars down.Are you using basal / bolus (both long and short acting insulin?)  YOu will need to work out your basal rate, and you will also need to count carbs and work out how much fast acting insulin to dose.  It is a bit complicated, and more so in pregnancy when things can change so fast.I would suggest the following books:-Think Like a PancreasDiabetes Solutions.  You can also go online and look up Bernstein Diabetes University.  He has quite a few sessions on U-tube and you can learn a lot.I also recommend, that you eat very low carb (for now at least) until you can get your insulin doses sorted out.  Moderate protein and enough fats to meet your calorie and energy needs.You can do this.    Best wishes to you and your baby.
